title: West Community Associates Joint Program: Combined Lecture on John Singer Sargent and Georg Jensen
hero_caption: John Singer Sargent. Mrs. George Swinton (Elizabeth Ebsworth), 1897. The Art Institute of Chicago, Wirt D. Walker Collection.&nbsp;
short_description: The registration period for this program has ended.
list_description: The registration period for this program has ended.
description:
John Singer Sargent (1856-1925), was one of the most sought-after portraitists of his generation on both sides of the Atlantic, creating powerful vibrant likenesses of his sitters. Best known for his portraits, Sargent nevertheless excelled in a variety of genres, including landscapes, watercolors, and murals. This talk explores the artist’s controversial and international career focusing on his relationship with Chicago and his undisputed influence in art history.

After having lunch on your own, you have several options to fill out your day. You may choose to hear Kathy Cummings discuss Georg Jensen: Scandinavian Design for Living. This exhibit is the first major American presentation of Jensen’s silver tableware and products for the home as it traces the changing ideals for modern living in the 20th century. You may also take a guided afternoon gallery tour of the exhibits: ‘Sargent and Portraiture’ led by Margaret Farr; and/or ‘Sargent and Manet’ led by Laura Mueller. Alternatively, explore both of the exhibits on your own.

Note: John Singer Sargent audio tours are available for $5 outside of the Sargent exhibition.

Location: Rubloff Auditorium, and Morton Auditorium or the galleries
Speakers: Giovanni Aloi (on Sargent) and Kathy Cummings (on Jensen)
Program capacity: 56
Registration period: Thursday, August 16, 2018 – Thursday, August 30, 2018

PLEASE NOTE: The registration period for this program has ended. Please consider joining us for other upcoming Community Associates programs.

For Community Associates events that allow guests, nonmember guests must be registered by a Community Associates member.
